Description: Rim sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; glaze fired orange-brown; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed below with two added white bands; exterior: narrow brown band at top of rim; below, frieze of pendent tongues above dash and billet pattern band; below, painted decoration consisting of sphinx (part of wing, rump and tail remaining) to right; pendant corner roundel and dotted cross as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Antikenmuseum, Heidelberg. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The sherd almost certainly belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1888,0601.478.d.+.
Bibliographic references: CVA Heidelberg I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Heidelberg Universität Band I (p. 13, no. 7, pl. 3)
Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 266, no. 598, pl. 75)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0592) (phase 2)
